intro: Echion, commonly known as the common echion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, adding to its ornamental appeal. Echion is valued for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
